English: --- Mikel, one of Nigeria’s greatest football exports – Siasia
Yoruba: --- Mikel jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára agbábọ́ọ̀lù Nàìjííríà tó ṣàṣeyọrí jùlọ  Siasia.

English: Former Super Eagles handler and ex-international, Samson Siasia says there was nothing special in his love for the Super Eagles Captain, Mikel Obi.
Yoruba: Agbábọ́ọ̀lù àti akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá àgbà ikọ̀ Super Eagles tẹ́lẹ̀rí, Samson Siasia sọ pé, kò sí nǹkan tí ó ṣe pàtàkì nínú ìfẹ́ tí òun ní sí balógun ikọ̀ Super Eagles, Mikel Obi.

English: Siasia was speaking on the reason for his preference for Obi who he took to the 2016 Olympics and returned with a silver.
Yoruba: Siasia yànàná ọ̀rọ̀ yìí látàrí awuyewuye mímú Obi lọ kópa nínú ìdíje 2016 Olympic, èyí tí ó sì gba àmì-ẹyẹ ipò kẹta silver wálé.

English: “There is nothing special between me and Obi; it’s only that I so much like him as a player.
Yoruba: Kò sí nǹkan tí ó ṣe pàtàkì láàrin èmi pẹ̀lú Ò̀bí; ó kàn jẹ́ pé mo nífẹ̀ẹ́ rẹ̀ púpọ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí agbábọ́òlù.

English: He is one of the greatest exports of Nigerian football.
Yoruba: Bẹ́ẹ̀ sìni Ó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù Nàìjííríà tí ó ti ṣàṣeyọrí nínú eré bọ́ọ̀lù lágbàáyé.

English: “Obi started playing for top clubs at an early stage in his life and has won virtually everything he wants and above all, he is a good and committed player.
Yoruba: Òbí kópa fún ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù tí ó lààmìlaaka láti ọjọ́ kékeré ayé rẹ̀, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni ó ti gba oríṣiríṣi ife-ẹ̀yẹ gẹ́gẹ́ bí agbábọ́ọ̀lù, ó sì tún jẹ́ akínkanjú ẹni tó ń fara jìn fún iṣẹ́ rẹ̀.

English: Furthermore, You can also see his contributions to the national team, so, who will not like such a player.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, ipa rẹ̀ nínú ikọ̀ Super Eagles kò ṣe é yẹ̀ sílẹ̀, fún ìdí èyí, tani kò ní nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí irú agbábọ́ọ̀lù yìí,".

English: He said Obi had done creditably well both at the club level and the Super Eagles.
Yoruba: Ó fikún un pé, Obi ti kópa dáradára nínú ikọ̀ rẹ̀ nílẹ̀ òkèèrè àti ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Super Eagles.

English: Siasia had once said Obi was a player at par with Real Madrid ace midfielder, Luka Modric and other best midfielder in the world.
Yoruba: Ní ìgbà kan rí, Siasia fi Obi wé agbábọ́ọ̀lù ọwọ́ àárín ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Real Madrid, Luka Modric àti àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù jàǹkànjàǹkàn mìíràn lágbàáyé.

English: Mikel represented Nigeria in the U-20 at the FIFA World Youth Championship and won the silver ball behind Lionel Messi and made his debut for the national team on Aug. 17, 2005.
Yoruba: Mikel lọ sojú Nàìjííríà nínú ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé tàwọn ọ̀dọ́ tọ́jọ́ orí wọn kò ju ogún ọdún lọ, FIFA U-20 World, tí Ó sì gba àmì ẹ̀yẹ agbábọ́ọ̀lù kẹta tí ó kópa jùlọ nínú ìdíje náà tẹ̀lé Lionel Messi, bẹ́ẹ̀ sí ni ó bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní kópa fún Super Eagles lọ́jọ́ kẹtàdínlógún oṣù kẹjọ ọdún 2005.

English: --- Morocco should host 2026 World Cup – Blatter
Yoruba: --- Morocco yóò ṣagbátẹrù ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé lọ́dún 2026 - Blatter.

English: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter has put his support behind Morocco’s bid to host the 2026 World Cup finals, saying the North African country would be the logical choice.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ àjọ FIFA tẹ́lẹ̀rí, Sepp Blatter ti gbè sí orílẹ̀-èdè Morocco lẹ́yìn láti ṣagbátẹrù ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé lọ́dún 2026, lẹ́yìn tí ó fọwọ́ sọ̀yà pé orílẹ̀-èdè ọ̀hún ti ó kángún sí àríwá gúsú ilẹ̀ Áfíríkà tó gbangba sùn lọ́yẹ́.

English: Morocco is bidding for the fifth time to host the World Cup finals, having also tried for the 1994, 1998, 2006 and 2010 tournaments.
Yoruba: Morocco ti ń gbèrò láti ṣagbátẹrù ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé fún ìgbà karùn-ún báyìí, bákan náà wọn tún gbìyànjú láti ṣagbátẹrù ìdíje náà lọ́dún 1994, 1998, 2006 àti ọdún 2010.

English: The only other bid is a joint one from the U.S., Canada and Mexico with football’s world governing body FIFA due to choose the hosts at its Congress in Moscow in June.
Yoruba: Àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè mìíràn tí ó tún gbèrò láti ṣagbátẹrù ìdíje yìí papọ̀ lórílẹ̀-èdè U.S, Canada àti Mexico, èyí tí ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń rí sí bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá lágbàáyé FIFA yóò ṣe ìpàdé àpérò rẹ̀ nínú oṣù kẹfà, ní Moscow láti mọ orílẹ̀-èdè tí ó kójú òsùwọ̀n jùlọ láti ṣagbátẹrù ìdíje náà.

English: “World Cup 2026: Co-hosting rejected by FIFA after 2002 (also applied in 2010 and 2018).
Yoruba: Ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé ọdún 2026: gbìgbìmọ̀pọ̀ láti ṣagbátẹrù ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé kò jẹ́ ìtẹ́wọ́gbà fún àjọ FIFA, lẹ́yìn èyí tí ó wáyé lọ́dún 2002.

English: And now: Morocco would be the logical host! And it is time for Africa again!”
Yoruba: Ní báyìí: Morocco ni ó ṣì láǹfààní báyìí láti ṣagbátẹrù rẹ̀, tí yóò sì tún fàyèsílẹ̀ fún ilẹ̀-Áfíríkà!"

English: Blatter, who was FIFA president from 1998 to 2015, turned against co-hosting after the 2002 World Cup in Japan and South Korea, the only time the tournament has been shared.
Yoruba: Blatter, tí ó jẹ́ ààrẹ àjọ FIFA láti ọdún 1998 sí 2015, kò tẹ́wọ́ gba àpapọ̀ ṣíṣe agbátẹrù ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé yìí láàrin orílẹ̀-èdè méjì, lẹ́yìn èyí tí ó ti wáyé lọ́dún 2002 ní Japan àti South Korea, èyí tí ó sì jẹ́ ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ rẹ̀ tí orílẹ̀-èdè méjì yóò gbìmọ̀pọ̀ láti ṣagbátẹrù ìdíje náà.

English: The eighty-one-year-old Swiss quit his post and was later banned for six years for ethics violations by FIFA’s ethics committee.
Yoruba: Ọmọ ọgọ́rin ọdún ọ̀hún, Blatter fipò rẹ̀ sílẹ̀, tí wọ́n sì tún fòfin dè é fún ọdún mẹ́fà látàrí títàpá sí ìlànà ìgbìmọ̀ àjọ FIFA.

English: The only tournament staged in Africa so far was the 2010 finals in South Africa, something Blatter is immensely proud of.
Yoruba: Irúfé ìdíje ńlá yìí tí o wáyé kẹ́yìn nílẹ̀ Áfíríkà, wáyé lórílẹ̀-èdè South Africa lọ́dún 2010, èyí tí Blatter kòsí kábàámọ̀ pé ilẹ̀-Áfíríkà ṣagbátẹrù rẹ̀.

English: --- Russia 2018: Aiteo hails NFF’s World Cup plans
Yoruba: --- Russia 2018: Aiteo gbóríyìn fún ètò NFF fún ìpalẹ̀mọ́ ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé.

English: Super Eagles official sponsor, Aiteo Group has expressed delight with the plans put in place by the nation’s soccer governing body, NFF ahead of the Russia 2018 World Cup.
Yoruba: Onígbọ̀wọ́ ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Super Eagles, ilé-iṣẹ́ epo rọ̀bì Aiteo ti fi ìdùnnú rẹ̀ hàn fún ètò àti ìpalẹ̀mọ́ ọlọ́kan-ò-jọ̀kan tí àjọ tó ń rí sí bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá ní Nàìjííríà, NFF ti ń pèsè sílẹ̀ ṣaájú ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé tó ń bọ̀ lọ́nà lórílẹ̀-èdè Russia.

English: Aiteo’s Deputy Managing Director, Francis Peters who spoke Monday night during the maiden NFF awards bankrolled by the oil giant said the company is delighted with Russia 2018 World Cup programme released recently by the NFF.
Yoruba: Igbákejì adarí ilé-iṣẹ́ Aiteo, Francis Peters, Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ lásìkò ìpàdé ìgbàmì-ẹ̀yẹ èyí tí ó wáyé nílùú Èkó lọ́jọ́ Ajé (Monday), Ó ní inú ilé-iṣẹ́ Aiteo dùn lọ́pọ̀lọpọ̀ fún àwọn ètò àjọ NFF tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ kéde fún ìpalẹ̀mọ́ ìdíje ńlá yìí.

English: He added that: “We are particularly delighted by NFF’s preparation for the tournament, as is evident in their World Cup plans recently publicized.
Yoruba: Ó fikún un pé Ní pàtàkì inú wá dùn púpọ̀ fún ìpalẹ̀mọ́ àjọ NFF ṣaájú ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lu àgbááyé yìí, èyí tí ó fara hàn gbangba gbàǹgbà pé ikọ̀ Super Eagles náà ti ṣetán fún ìdíje náà.

English: For the  Super Eagles, our wish is that the team matches our expectation.
Yoruba: Èrò wa ni láti rí Super Eagles kí ó kópa dáradára kọjá èròńgbà wa.

English: AITEO as Super Eagles Official Sponsor will certainly be in Russia to offer support and encouragement in our usual way.
Yoruba: AITEO tí ó jẹ́ onígbọ̀wọ́ ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Super Eagles yóò wà ní digbí lórílẹ̀-èdè Russia fún àtìlẹyìn tí ò lẹ́gbẹ́ àti igbani-níyànjú.

English: To demonstrate our commitment to achieving a successful World Cup outing, we have paid the sum of $600,000 and N320 million to cover our contractual obligation of providing support to the technical crew of all the teams for the whole of 2018, well beyond the World Cup.”
Yoruba: Láti ṣàfihàn mímú ikọ̀ yìí lọ́kùn-únkúndùn, pàápàá jùlọ fún ikọ̀ náà láti lọ ṣàṣeyọrí nínú ìdíje yìí, à ti san ọgbòn ọ̀kẹ́  owo dollar ($600,000) àti okòólélọ́ọ̀ọ́dúnrún mílíọ́nù owo Naira (N320 million) láti pèsè àwọn ohun èlò lọ́lọ́kan-ò-jọ̀kan fún ìgbáradì ní kíkún fún ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbáyé yìí.

English: Peters stressed that Aiteo is also impressed with the efforts being made by the new leaders of African football governing body, CAF to take African football to the next level, even as he commended  FIFA for piloting the growth and development of football globally.
Yoruba: "Peters tèsíwájú pé, inú òun dùn púpọ̀, bẹ́ẹ̀ sìni ó jẹ́ ohun ìwúrí láti rí àwọn olùdarí àgbà tuntun àjọ tó ń rí sí bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá nílẹ̀ Áfírík̀a CAF fún àtìlẹyìn àti akitiyan wọn láti gbé bọ́ọ̀lù ẹ̀yà Afrika dé ìpele tí ó lápẹẹrẹ, bákan náà, àjọ FIFA fún ìgbèrú tí ó ṣeé yẹ̀ sílẹ̀ tí wọ́n mú bá bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá lágbàáyé.

English: Peters further gave a pat on the back to Lagos State governor, Akinwumi Ambode who he noted shares the same vision with Aiteo, that of taking Nigerian and African football to greater heights.
Yoruba: Peters tún gbóríyìn fún Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó, Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Akínwùmí Ambode àti ìjọba rẹ̀ fún àtìlẹyìn wọn láti mú ìgbèrú bá bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá ní Nàìjííríà àti ní ilẹ̀ Áfíríkà.

English: --- MFM advance to second round at the CAF Champions League
Yoruba: --- MFM FC pegedé sínú ìpele kejì ìdíje CAF Champions League.

English: MFM FC of Lagos on Wednesday booked their way to the second round of the CAF Champions League with a 1-0 win over AS Bamako of Mali in Lagos.
Yoruba: MFM FC ilú Èkó, nínú ìfigagbága ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ tí ó wáyé lọ́jọ́ru (Wednesday), ikọ̀ ọ̀hún pegedé sínú ìpele kejì ìdíje CAF Champions League, léyìn tí wọ́n fàgbà han ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù AS Bamako orílẹ̀-èdè Mali pẹ̀lú àmì-ayò kan sóódo (1-0).

English: MFM qualified in all the competitions after played one goal in the first competition that came up in mali before playing one goal to nothing at Agege stadium.
Yoruba: MFM pegedé lápapọ̀ àmì-ayò ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ọ̀hún, lẹ́yìn tí ikọ̀ ọ̀hún gbá àmì-ayò kọ̀ọ̀kan nínú ìfigagbága àkọ́kọ́ tí ó wáyé lórílẹ̀-èdè Mali, kí wọn ó tó wá gbá àmì-ayò kan sóódo ní pápá ìṣeré Agége.

English: Akuneto Chijioke scored the singular goal in the second half of the competition, which Lawal Abayomi a sixteen year old player assisted in scoring the goal.
Yoruba: Akuneto Chijioke ló gbá àmì ayò kan ṣoṣo ọ̀hún wọlé ní sáà kejì ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ náà, èyí tí Lawal Àbáyọ̀mí ọmọ ọdún mẹ́rìndínlógún ṣì ṣe ìrànwọ́ àmì-ayò ọ̀hún.

English: He added that, my playershave proved themselves that they are qualified.
Yoruba: Ó fikún un pe, Àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù mi ti fi ara wọn hàn pé àwọn tó gbangba sùn lọ́yẹ́.

English: And we are assuring our fans and the government of Lagos that we will not disappoint them at anytime.
Yoruba: Bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni, a fi ń da àwọn olólùfẹ́ wa àti ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó lójú pé, a kò ní jáwọn kulẹ̀ nígbà kankan.

English: The player that did not play for MFM FC are Sikiru Olatunbosun, Akila /jesse, Shola Brossa and Waheed Akanni, and this came up as a result of the challenge during the registration for the competition.
Yoruba: "Ẹ̀wẹ̀, àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù tí kò kópa fún MFM FC nínú wọn la ti rí, Sikiru Ọlátúnbọ̀sún, Akila /Jesse, Ṣhọlá Brossa àti Waheed Àkànní, èyí sì wáyé látàrí ìdojúkọ tí ó wáyé lásìkò ìforúkọsílẹ̀ fún ìdíje náà.

English: --- Infantino insists Russia ready to host World Cup
Yoruba: --- Infantino:-Russia ṣetán láti ṣagbátẹrù ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé.

English: Fifa president Gianni Infantino insisted on Tuesday said that Russia is ready to host the World Cup later this year.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ àjọ FIFA, Gianni Infantino sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ìgbésẹ̀ ìgbáradì tí Russia ti gbé láti gbàlejò ìdíje lọ́dún yìí.

English: --- FIFA President- Football is more than a religion in Nigeria
Yoruba: --- Ààrẹ FIFA- Bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá ní Nàìjííríà ju ọ̀rọ̀ ẹ̀sìn lọ.

English: FIFA President Gianni Infantino has described Nigeria as a country with unquantifiable passion and love for football, and where football is more than a religion.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ àjọ FIFA, Gianni Infantino ti ṣàlàyé bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá ní Nàìjííríà gẹ́gẹ́ bí ohun tí ó ju ọ̀rọ̀ ẹ̀sìn lọ.

English: The event held at the Eko Hotels and Suites saw Chelsea FC winger Victor Moses winning the “Player of the Year” award.
Yoruba: Nínú ìpàdé ìgbàmì ẹ̀yẹ ọ̀hún tí ó wáyé nílé ìtura Eko Hotels and Suites, ni wọ́n ti fi àmì-ẹ̀yẹ agbábọ́ọ̀lù tí ó dára jùlọ tí àjọ NFF dá agbábọ́ọ̀lù ikọ̀ Chelsea FC, Victor Moses lọ́lá.

English: Moses also helped his Chelsea side reclaim the English Premier League title in the 2016/2017 season where he featured in 40 games.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, Moses tún gba ife-ẹ̀yẹ ìdíje EPL fún ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Chelsea ní sáà 2016/2017, tí ó sì kópa nínú ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ogójì fún ikọ̀ náà.

English: Other winners at the awards include Rasheedat Ajibade who claimed the “Player of the Year (Women)’’ award and Ikouwon Udoh who emerged “Young Player of the Year (Women)’’.

English: Ann Chiejine won the “Coach of the Year (Women)’’ award, while MFM FC’s midfielder Sikiru Olatunbosun took the “Goal of the Year’’ award.
Yoruba: Ann Chiejine, akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá tí ó dára jùlọ Coach of the Year (Women),  tí agbábọ́ọ̀lù ikọ̀ MFM FC, Sikiru Ọlátúnbọ̀sún gba àmì-ẹ̀yẹ àmì ayò tí ó dára jùlọ

English: The “Coach of the Year (Men)’’ award went to Kennedy Boboye, coach of 2017/2018 NPFL champions Plateau United FC of Jos.
Yoruba: Kennedy Bòbóyè, tí ó jẹ́ akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá àgbà ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Plateau United FC tìlùú Jos.

English: Channels Television won the “Developmental Award”.
Yoruba: Channels Television gba àmì-ẹ̀yẹ Developmental Award".

English: --- Tennis: Roger Federer wins Rotterdam Open
Yoruba: --- Tennis: Roger Federer gba ife-ẹ̀yẹ Rotterdam Open.

English: Roger Federer celebrated his impending return to the top of the world rankings by winning the Rotterdam Open on Sunday, his 97th title.
Yoruba: Roger Federer ṣayẹyẹ ìpadàsípò kínni rè lágbàáyé pẹ̀lú gbígba ife-ẹ̀yẹ Rotterdam Open lọ́jọ́ Àìkú (Sunday), èyí tí ó jẹ́ ife-ẹ̀yẹ mẹ́tàdínlógórun lápapọ̀ tí ó ti gbà báyìí.

English: The 36-year-old, the oldest ATP No.1 in history, thrashed Bulgarian Grigor Dimitrov 6-2, 6-2 in a one-sided final.
Yoruba: Ọmọ ọdún mọ́kàndínlógójì náà, tí ó sì tún jẹ́ olùkópa tí ó dàgbà jùlọ nínú ìtàn ìdíje ATP, fàgbà han akẹẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ láti orílẹ̀-èdè Bulgaria, Grigor Dimitrov pẹ̀lú àmì-ayò mẹ́fà sí mẹ́ji (6-2), nínú àṣekágbá ìfigagbága ẹ̀ẹ̀kan ṣoṣo ọ̀hún.

English: In the Open era, only American Jimmy Connors has won more titles than Swiss master Federer, with 109.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, olùkópa ọmọ bíbí orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà, Jimmy Connors nìkan ní àpapọ̀ ìfe-ẹ̀yẹ tí ó gbà jù ti Federer lọ, lẹ́yìn tí ó ti gba ife-ẹ̀yẹ tí ó lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún.

English: Federer, the record 20-time Grand Slam winner, will retake the number one ranking he last held in October 2012 when the official ATP rankings are published on Monday.
Yoruba: Federer, ẹni tí ó ti gba àmì-ẹ̀yẹ Grand Slam ní ìgbà ogún báyìí, yóò tún gba ipò kínní rẹ̀ padà tí ipò àtẹ tuntun ATP mìíràn bá jáde lọ́sẹ̀ tí a wà yìí.

English: --- Didier Drogba son joined Guingamp football club.
Yoruba: --- Ọmọ Didier Drogba dara pọ̀ mọ́ ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Guingamp.

English: Guingamp football team made this known on the internet on Monday.
Yoruba: Ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Guingamp sọ̀rọ̀ ọ̀hún di mímọ̀ lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára lọ́jọ́ Ajé (Monday).

English: The seventeen year old Isaac Drogba will also play for Guingamp football team where his father played for the past sixteen years.
Yoruba: Ọmọ ọdún mẹ́tàdínlógún ọ̀hún, Isaac Drogba yóò tún lọ kópa fún ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Guingamp, tí bàbá rẹ̀ ti kópa fún lọ́dún mẹ́rìndínlógún sẹ́yìn.

English: Drogba showed his delight after congratulating his son on Instagram, I am encouraged to see Isaac join Guingamp.
Yoruba: Drogba fi ìdùnú rẹ̀ hàn lẹ́yìn tí ó kí ọmọ rẹ̀ kú oríire lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára Instagram,"ó jẹ́́ ohun ìwúrí fún mi láti ríi pé Isaac dara pọ̀ mọ́ Guingamp".

English: Didier Drogba played for Guingamp football team for a season before he joined Le Mans football team in 2002.
Yoruba: Didier Drogba kópa fún ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Guingamp fún sáà kan, kí ó tó lọ dara pọ̀ mọ́ ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Le Mans lọ́dún 2002.

English: Drogba left Marseille football team, and joined Chelsea, where he took the EPL medal and UEFA champions League.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, Drogba tún fikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Marseille sílẹ̀, tí ó sì tún lọ dara pọ̀ mọ́ ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Chelsea, níbi tí ó ti gba ife-ẹ̀yẹ ìdíje EPL àti ìdíje UEFA Champions League.

English: --- Won will use VAR technology in Africa.
Yoruba: --- Wọn yóò ṣàmúlò ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé VAR nílẹ̀ Áfíríkà.

Yoruba: Ní báyìí, fún ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ wọn yóò lo ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé Fonran, Video Assistant Referee [VAR] nílẹ̀ Áfíríkà ní pápá ìṣeré Stade Mohammed V, Casablanca lọ́jọ́ Àbámẹ́ta (Saturday).

English: CAF made this known that the mordrn technology will be used in the 2018 caf Super Cup which will comeup between Wydad Athletic club and TP Mazembe football club on Saturday.
Yoruba: Àjọ tó ń rí sí bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá nílẹ̀ Áfíríkà CAF, ló sọ ọ̀rọ̀ ọ̀hún di mímọ̀ pé, wọn yóò lo ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé náà nínú ìdíje 2018 Caf Super Cup, èyí tí yóò wáyé láàrin ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Wydad Athletic Club àti TP Mazembe lọ́jọ́ Àìkú (Saturday).

English: The 2018 CAF Super Cup competition, will come up between the team that won the cup in 2017 CAF Champions League and team which won the 2017 CAF confederation Cup.
Yoruba: Ìfigagbága ìdíje 2018 CAF Super Cup , ni ó máa ń wáyé láàrin ikọ̀ tí ó bá gba ife-ẹ̀yẹ 2017 Caf Champions League àti ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù tí ó bá gba ife-ẹ̀yẹ 2017 Caf Confederation Cup.

English: Due to the use of the modern machine in the Africa Nations Championship that will come up in Morocco, CAF and the International Football Association Board (IFAB) and FIFA has agreed to make use of VAR in the 2018 CAF Super Cp coming.
Yoruba: Ẹ́̀wẹ̀, látàrí ṣíṣe àmúlò ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé ọ̀hún nínú ìdíje African Nations Championship tí ó wáyé lórílẹ̀-èdè Morocco, àjọ Caf, ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń rí sí bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá nílẹ̀-òkèrè, International Football Association Board (IFAB) àti àjọ tó ń rí sí bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá lágbàáyé FIFA, ti fẹnukò papọ̀ láti tún ṣàmúlò ẹ̀rọ VAR ọ̀hún nínú ìdíje 2018 Caf Super Cup tó ń bọ̀ lọ́nà.

English: According to the secretary general of CAF Amr Fahmy.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí akọ̀wé àgbà àjọ CAF, Amr Fahmy.

English: This is a history in football game in Africa.
Yoruba: Èyí jẹ́ ohun ìtàn nínú eré ìdárayá bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá nílẹ̀ Áfíríkà.

English: Also the chairman of the CAF competitions Eddy Maillet show his delight for the lunching of the modern machine in Africa.
Yoruba: "Bákan náà, alákòóso olùdarí àwọn ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ àjọ CAF, Eddy Maillet fi ìdùnú rẹ̀ hàn fún ìfilọ́lẹ̀ ṣíṣe àmúlò ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé náà nílẹ̀ Áfíríkà.

English: He continued that they are very ready to use the VAR in the subsequent CAF competition that will be coming up.
Yoruba: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé, àwọn ti ṣetán láti ṣe àmúlò ẹ̀rọ VAR náà nínú ọ̀kan-ò-jọ̀kan ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ CAF tí yóò máa wáyé.

English: --- Ganduje to grace Ramat Cup final
Yoruba: --- Ganduje yóò buyi-kùn àṣekágbá ìdíje Ramat Cup.

English: Governor Abdullahi Umar Ganduje of Kano State will today be the Special Guest of honour at the finals of the 36th edition of the ongoing Ramat Cup competition being organised by the Youth Sports Federation of Nigeria in conjunction with the Kano State Government.
Yoruba: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Kano, ọ̀gbẹ́ni Abdullahi Umar Ganduje, yóò jẹ́ àlejò pàtàkì nínú àṣekágbá mẹ́rìndínlógójì ìdíje Ramat Cup, èyí tí ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Kano àti àjọ tó ń rí sí bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá àti ìdàgbàsókè àwọn ọ̀dọ́ lórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjííríà ṣagbátẹrù rẹ̀.

English: Disclosing this yesterday, National President of YSFON, Nasiru Gawuna stated that apart from the governor, members of the state Executive Council and some service chiefs are also expected to witness the finals of the oldest grassroots football tournament in the country organised to honour Nigeria’s former Head of State, late Gen. Murtala Mohammed.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ààrẹ YSFON, Násírù Gawuna ṣe sọ, Ó ní yàtọ̀ sí gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Kano, àwọn tí wọn yóò tún máa retí láti buyì kún àṣekágbá ìdíje náà, èyí tí wọ́n ṣàgbékalẹ̀ rẹ̀ láti ṣèrántí olóògbé Gen. Murtala Mohammed ni àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin ìpínlẹ̀ ọ̀hún àti àwọn èèyàn jàǹkàn-jàǹkàn lóríṣiríṣi nípìnlẹ̀ náà àti lórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjííríà.

English: Gawuna explained that governor wanted to be at the final because of his love for youth empowerment and development of grassroots sports in the country.
Yoruba: Gawuna ṣàlàyé pé, Gomina Ganduje fẹ́ láti kópa nínú àṣekágbá ìdíje náà látàrí ìfẹ́ tí ó ní fún ìdàgbàsókè àwọn ọ̀dọ́ àti fún eré-ìdárayá.

English: “Ganduje is a sports loving governor, who is always ready to assist the youths develop their talents and become useful citizens and that is why he wants to be physically present in the finals,” he said.
Yoruba: Ganduje jẹ́ Gómìnà tí ó fẹ́ràn eré-ìdárayá púpọ̀, tí ó sì máa ń setán láti ran àwọn ọ̀dọ́ lọ́wọ́ nípasẹ̀ kíkún wọn lọ́wọ́ láti mú ìgbèrú bá ẹ̀bùn tí wọ́n ní fún àǹfààní àwọn ará-ìlú àti ìdàgbàsókè orílẹ̀-èdè.

English: To get to the Ramat Cup fina, Kano defeated Kwara 1-0 in the first semifinal, while Lagos State that earlier lost by the same margin to Kebbi State had the victory upturned in her favour after her opponent was discovered to have used an ineligible player.
Yoruba: Nínú ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ìpele kejì sí àṣekágbá ìdíje Ramat Cup ọ̀hún, ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù kano fàgbà han Kwara pẹ̀lú àmì-ayò kan sóódo (1-0), bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó jẹ oore-ọ̀fẹ́ aṣemáse tí ìpínlẹ̀ Kebbi ṣe, lẹ́yìn tí ikọ̀ ọ̀hún lo agbábọ́ọ̀lù ti ́kò lẹ́tọ̀ọ́ láti kópa nínú ìdíje náà, èyí tí ó ṣokùnfa bí ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó ṣe yege sínú àṣekágbá ìdíje ọ̀hún.

English: Meanwhile, the host stare, Kano will meet Lagos in the finals to be decided at the Kano Pillars Stadium, Sabon Garri, Kano.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, Kano tí ó ṣagbátẹrù ìdíje ọ̀hún, yóò máa wàákò pẹ̀lú ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó nínú ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ tí yóò máa wáyé ní pápá ìṣeré ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Kano Pillars, Sabon Garri, Kano.

English: --- NPFL: Abia Warriors beats Yobe Desert Stars
Yoruba: --- NPFL: Abia Warriors fàgbà han Yobe Desert Stars.

English: Hosts Abia Warriors Football Club on Sunday rediscovered their winning streak with a 3-1 bashing of visiting Yobe Desert Stars FC in the match played at the Umuahia Township Stadium.
Yoruba: Ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Abia Warriors FC lọ́jọ́ Àìkú (Sunday) gbo ewúro sí akẹẹgbẹ́ wọn lójú láti ìpínlẹ̀ Yobe, Yobe Desert Stars FC pẹ̀lú àmì-ayò mẹ́ta sóókan (3-1), ní pápá ìṣeré Umuahia Township Stadium.

English: Abia Warriors’ forward Effiong Ndifereke helped to turn the team’s fortunes around with a brace in the ninth and 29th minutes. Sam Obi scored Abia Warriors’ second goal at the 16th minute during a goal-mouth scramble.
Yoruba: Atamátàsé ikọ̀ ọ̀hún Effiong Ndifereke ló gbá àmì-ayò kínní wọlé níṣẹ̀ẹ́jú mọ́kàndínlọ́gbọ̀n sáà àkọ́kọ́ ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ọ̀hún, béẹ̀ sì ni Sam Obi gbá àmì-ayò kejì wọlé kí sáà àkọ́kọ́ ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ náà ó tó wá sí ìparí.

English: The Damaturu- based boys sustained the pressure until the 79th minute, when Manika Usman’s grounder beat Abia Warriors’ goalkeeper for the visitors’ lone goal.
Yoruba: Bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé, ikọ̀ Yobe Desert ṣe gudugudu méje òhun yàhàyà mẹfà láti gba àmì-ayò kan wọlé níṣẹ̀ẹ́jú mọ́kàndínlọ́gọ́rin sáà kejì ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ náà, ṣùgbọ́n omi pọ̀ ju ọkà lọ, lẹ́yìn tí Abia Warrios tún gbá àmi-ayò mìíràn wọ̀lé, ẹ̀yí tí ó kásẹ̀ ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ náà nílẹ̀.

English: Yobe Stars’ coach Ganaru Mohammed, in a post-match interview, said he was disappointed with the outcome of the game.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá ikọ̀ Yobe Stars, Ganaru Mohammed ṣe sọ,"Èsì ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ yìí bàmí nínú jẹ́ púpọ̀.

English: Also speaking, Abia Warriors’ coach Emmanuel Deutsch attributed the team’s victory to hard work and resilience.
Yoruba: Akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá àgbà Abia Warriors Emmanuel Deutsch gbósùbà káre láí fún ikọ̀ rẹ̀ lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n jáwé olúborí nínú ìfigagbága náà.

English: --- FIFA ranking: Nigeria drops one spot further
Yoruba: --- Nàìjííríà já wálẹ̀ nínú ipò àtẹ àjọ FIFA.

English: Nigeria has dropped further one spot in the latest FIFA ranking released by the football governing body on Thursday.
Yoruba: Nàìjííríà já wálẹ̀ nínú ipò àtẹ tuntun àjọ FIFA, èyí tí ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń rí sí bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá lágbàáyé gbé jáde lọ́jọ́bọ (Thursday).

English: The Super Eagles, who were 51st in the world with 651 points in January, are now 52nd with 606 points, according to the ranking on FIFA’s official website on Thursday.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí àtẹ̀jáde àjọ FIFA tí ó jáde nínú ẹ̀rọ ayélujára wọn lọ́jọ́bọ (Thursday) ṣe sọ, Ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Super Eagles tí ó wà ní ipò mọ́kànléláàádọ́tà lágbàáyé pẹ̀lú àmì ọ̀tàlélẹ́gbẹ̀ta-dín-,mẹ́ta nínú oṣù-kínní ọdún yìí.

English: The Nigeria team finished second at the African Nations Championship in Morocco recently.
Yoruba: Ikọ̀ Nàìjííríà sepò kejì nínú ìdíje CHAN tí ó wáyé lórílẹ̀-èdè Morocco.

English: Having dropped in the January edition of the release due to the deduction of points from the World Cup qualifiers, most Nigerians would have hoped for an improvement, but that has not been the case.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, lẹ́yìn tí ikọ̀ ọ̀hún já wálẹ̀ nínú àtẹ̀jáde ipò àtẹ FIFA lósù tí ó kọjá látàrí dídín àmì ikọ̀ náà tí wọ́n fi pegedé fún ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé, ọ̀pọ̀ nínú àwọn olólùfẹ́ ikọ̀ Super-Eagles ló fọkàn si pé, ipò àtẹ mìíràn yóò wá sókè, ṣùgbọ́n tí kò rí bẹ́ẹ̀.

English: The Super Eagles, however, remain seventh in Africa, where Tunisia, Senegal, DR Congo, CHAN champions Morocco, Egypt and Cameroon make up Africa’s top six countries.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, Super Eagles dipò keje mú nílẹ̀ Áfíríkà, tí orílẹ̀-èdè Tunisia, Senegal, DR Congo, Morocco, Egypt àti Cameroon sì tẹ̀léra wọn.

English: Ghana, Burkina Faso and Algeria are eighth, ninth and 10th respectively in Africa.
Yoruba: Orílẹ̀-èdè Ghana, Burkina Faso àti Algeria náà tẹ̀léra wọn pẹ̀lú ipò kẹjọ, kẹsàn-án àti ìkẹwà-á lórí ipò àtẹ túntún ọ̀hún.

English: The next FIFA World Ranking will be released on March 15.
Yoruba: Ipò àtẹ tuntun mìíran yóò tún jáde lọ́jọ́ karùndínlógún oṣù kẹta .

English: --- Ronaldo sets record with 100th UEFA Champions League goal
Yoruba: --- Ronaldo fìtàn balẹ̀ nínú ìdíje Uefa Champions League gbígbá ọ̀gọ́rùn-ún àmì-ayò. wọ̀lé

English: Cristiano Ronaldo on Wednesday became the first player to score 100 Champions League goals for the same club. This was when he found the net in Real Madrid’s last 16 clash at home to Paris Saint-Germain.
Yoruba: Atamátàsé ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Real-madrid, Cristiano Ronaldo di agbábọ́ọ̀lù àkọ́kọ́ tí yóò gbá ọ̀gọ́rùn-ún àmì-ayò wọ̀lé nínú ìtàn ìdíje Uefa Champions League fún ikọ̀ kan-náà, lẹ́yìn tí ó gbá àmì-ayò méjì wọ̀lé nínú ìfagagbága pẹ̀lú ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Paris Saint-German lọ́jọ́rú (Wednesday).

English: Real Madrid came back from a goal down to defeat PSG 3-1 at the Santiago Bernabeu.

English: --- Akwa-Ibom stadium received the best stadium award.

English: The award was given to the state during the celebration organized by the ministry of sprort and youth development  in this nation.
Yoruba: Àmì-ẹ̀yẹ ọ̀hún náà fi ta ìpínlẹ̀ náà lọ́rẹ lásìkò ayẹyẹ tí ó wáyé nílùú Abuja tí ilé-iṣẹ́ tó ń rí sí eré-ìdárayá àti ìdàgbàsókè àwọn ọ̀dọ́ lórílẹ̀-èdè yìí ṣagbátẹrù rẹ̀.

English: The award was one of the three awards taken by the state in the celebration program.

English: The state also received Diamond award for the best state sponsoring different programs for the development of of sport, and also received the award of commited sport fan in this nation.
Yoruba: Ìpínlẹ̀ náà tún gba àmì-ẹ̀yẹ Diamond fún ìpínlẹ̀ tó ń ṣagbátẹrù ètò lọ́lọ́kan-ò-jọ̀kan fún ìdàgbàsókè eré-ìdárayá jùlọ, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni wọ́n tún gba àmì-ẹ̀yẹ akínkanjú, òǹfara jìn olólùfẹ́ eré-ìdárayá lórílẹ̀-èdè yìí.

English: According to Udoh, receiving the three awards shows the good work that the Governor Udom Emmanuel did to take sport more importantly in the state.

English: He emphasis that all that we have done has brought a good result now, even to the success of the sponsoring the super Eagles which will take part in the world cup and we also have two football teams in the men and women in this nation.
Yoruba: Ó tẹnumọ́ ọn pe, gbogbo ohun tí a ti ṣe ló ti so èso rere báyìí, tí ó fi mọ́ ṣíṣe àṣeyọrí agbátẹrù ìpolongo ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Super Eagles tí yóò kópa nínú ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni tí a tún ní ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù méjì nínú ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá tọkùnrin àti tobìnrin torílẹ̀-èdè yìí,"

English: In conclusion the chairman of the award program, Phillips asiegba said accepting Super Eagles and different support of the state government and her fans brought about the success and victory in the world competition.

English: --- FIFA executive summit to hold in Lagos
Yoruba: --- Ìpàdé Àjọ FIFA yóò wáyé nílùú Èkó.

English: The Nigeria Football Federation has confirmed that FIFA will hold one of their 12 FIFA Executive Football Summit (EFS) meetings in Lagos, Nigeria.
Yoruba: Àjọ tó ń rí si eré-ìdárayá bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá lórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjííríà, NFF sọ pé, ìpàdé àwọn tọ́rọ̀ kàn gbọ̀ngbọ̀n nínú Àjọ tó ń rí sí bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá lágbàáyé, FIFA yóò wáyé nílùú Ékó, lórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjííríà, èyí tí yóò jẹ́ ìpàdé kejìlá irúfẹ́ ìpàdé ọ̀hún báyìí, 12 FIFA Executive Football Summit (EFS).

English: The FIFA Executive Football Summit meeting is expected to hold between November 2017 and March 2018.  This was confirmed by the Nigeria Football Federation boss Amaju Pinnick in an address to the press.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Ààrẹ àjọ NFF, Amaju Pinnick ṣe sọ lásìkò tó ń bá àwọn akọ̀ròyìn sọ̀rọ̀ nílùú Abuja,"Ìpàdé náà ni ìrètí wà tẹ́lẹ̀ pé yóò wáyé nínú oṣù kọkànlá ọdún 2017 sí oṣù kẹta ọdún 2018.

English: Twelve presidents from African and six from the Caribbean are scheduled to report on their experiences and country-specific issues and bring themselves up to date on the global game in the summit that will provide all of the delegates with an opportunity to share their knowledge and coordinate next steps.
Yoruba: "Ẹ̀wẹ̀, àwọn tí yóò máa kópa nínú ìpàdé ọ̀hún nìrètí wà pé, wọn yóò mú ọ̀kan-ò-jọ̀kan ìrírí àti ìdojúkọ tí orílẹ̀-èdè wọn là kọjá, eléyìí tí wọn yóò kojú nínú ìpàdé ọ̀hún.

English: Also expected is CAF President , Ahmad Ahmad  together with FIFA General Secretary, Fatima Samba Samoura, President of the Dutch FA, Michael Van Praag and Slavisa Ikokezia, who is current President of Serbia Federation
Yoruba: Ìròyìn sọ pé, lára àwọn èèyàn pàtàkì tí yóò máa kópa nínú ìpàdé ọ̀hún ni: Ààrẹ àjọ CAF, Ahmad Ahmad, akọ̀wé àgbà àjọ FIFA, Fatima Samba Samoura, Ààrẹ àjọ tó ń rí sí bọ́ọ̀lù afẹ́sẹ̀gbá lórílẹ̀-èdè Netherland, Michael Van Praag àti Slavisa Ikokezia, tí ó jẹ́ ààrẹ tuntun àjọ bọ́ọ̀lù afẹsẹ̀gbá lórílẹ̀-èdè Serbia.

English: “Gianni Infantino will be in Nigeria on Monday for the FIFA Executive Summit which will be a three-day event and this will bring all international media down to Nigeria,” Pinnick said.
Yoruba: Pinnick fikún ọrọ rẹ̀ pé, Ààrẹ àjọ FIFA, Gianni Infantino yóò gúnlẹ̀ sí Nàìjííríà lọ́jọ́ Ajé (Monday) fún ìpàdé ọlọ́jọ́ mẹ́ta ọ̀hún, bẹ́ẹ̀ sìni yóò mú àwọn akọ̀ròyìn lágbàáyé wá sórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjííríà,"

English: --- NFF mourns Mgbolu
Yoruba: --- NFF ń kẹ́dùn ikú Mgbolu.

English: The Nigerian Football Federation on Wednesday lamented the death of its former spokesman Austin Mgbolu.
Yoruba: Àjọ tó ń rí sí bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá lórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjííríà , NFF ti ṣe ìkẹ́dùn ikú agbẹnusọ̀rọ̀ àjọ ọ̀hún tẹ́lẹ̀rí,  Austin Mgbolu.

English: In a statement  by spokesman for the federation Ademola  Olajire, the (NFF) said Mgbolu, who served as Public Relations Officer of then (NFA) between 1993 and 2001, was “a highly conscientious, energetic and dedicated professional and left giant marks for predecessors to follow”.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, nínú ọ̀rọ̀ tí agbẹnusọ̀rọ̀ àjọ náà Adémọ́lá  Ọlájíire sọ,"Mgbolu ṣiṣẹ́ gẹ́gẹ́ bí agbẹnusọ̀rọ̀ àjọ (NFA) fún sáà 1993 sí 2001. Ó fi kún ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ pé," Ó jé akínkanjú ènìyàn, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni Mgbolu fi ara rẹ̀ jìn fún iṣẹ́, tí ó sì fi àpẹẹrẹ rere sílẹ̀ kí ó tó jáde láyé".

English: The statement quoted the (NFF) General Secretary Mohammed Sanusi as saying, “Reports said Mgbolu had a major surgery last month and appeared to have regained good health, before complications early on Wednesday morning led to his being rushed to the hospital where he died.”
Yoruba: Bákan náà, akọ̀wé àgbà àjọ (NFF), Mohammed Sanusi ṣàlàyé pé, ìròyìn sọ pé Mgbolu ṣe iṣẹ́-abẹ lóṣù tí ó kọjá, léyìí tí ó sì fara hàn pé ara rẹ̀ ti mókun, ṣùgbọ́n tí àìsàn ọ̀hún tún peléke sí lọ́jọ́ru (Wednesday) léyìí tí ó ṣokùnfa ilé-ìwòsàn tí ó ti jáde láye.

English: --- Eagles World Cup kits unveiled

English: The  jerseys  feature the home kits that pay tribute to  the 1994 squad  which they wore during the USA ’94  World Cup qualifiers.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, aṣọ̀ tuntun ọ̀hún ló ṣàfihàn ẹ̀wù tí ikọ̀ Super-Eagles wọ̀ nínú ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ìpegedé ìdíje àgbááyé USA  94.

English: Alex Iwobi and Sophia Omidiji were among the models at the unveiling.
Yoruba: Alex Iwobi àti Sophia Omidiji wà lára àwọn tí o ṣàfihàn ẹ̀wù bọ́ọ̀lù tuntun ọ̀hún.

English: The Eagles  will wear the jerseys  for the first time when they face Poland in a friendly in Warsaw before the commencement of their World Cup campaign against Croatia at the Kaliningrad Stadium on June 16.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, Eagles yóò lo ẹ̀wù tuntun náà fún ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ nínú ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ọlọ́rẹ̀ẹ́jọ̀rẹ́ tí yóò wáyé láàrin ikọ̀ náà àti orílẹ̀-èdè Poland, kí wọn ó tó tẹkọ̀ létí lọ gbá ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ àkọ́kọ́ pẹ̀lú Croatia nínú ìdíje àgbááyé.

English: “A constant in Nigeria is an endearing love of football,.
Yoruba: Nǹkan tí ikọ̀ le yí padà lórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjííríà ni ìfẹ́ eré bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá.

English: The new Nike kit designs honour our federation’s rich traditions.
Yoruba: Bẹ́ẹ̀ sìni, ẹ̀wù tuntun ọ̀hún ni Nike pèsè láti buyì kún àṣà orílẹ̀-èdè yìí.

English: --- Rohr picks two CHAN Eagles for World Cup
Yoruba: --- Rohr mú agbábọ́ọ̀lù CHAN Eagles méjì fún ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé.

English: Super Eagles coach Gernot Rohr has picked two players from 2018 CHAN to be part of his World Cup preparations – goalkeeper Ikechukwu Ezenwa and central defender Stephen Eze.

English: “Rohr has decided to pick Ezenwa and Eze for his World Cup preparations and it is now up to the two players to fight for a place in the final squad to Russia,” a top official disclosed.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọ̀kan gbòógì lára òṣìṣẹ́ NFF ṣe sọ, Rohr ti pinnu láti mú Ezenwa àti Eze láti kópa nínú àwọn ikọ̀ rẹ̀ tí yóò kó lọ fún ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé. Ó fikún ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ pé, ò wá kù sọ́wọ̀ àwọn méjèèjì láti jà fún ààyè wọ̣n nínú ikọ̀ náà.

English: Nigeria reached the final of the CHAN in Morocco, where they lost to the home team.
Yoruba: " Nàìjííríà pegedé sínú àṣekágbá ìdíje CHAN tí ó wáyé lórílẹ̀-èdè Morocco, ṣùgbọ́n wọ́n pàdánù ife-ẹ̀yẹ ọ̀hún sọ́wọ́ Morocco.

English: Rohr has already announced he will name his squad for two important World Cup warm-up matches against Poland and Serbia by the first week of next month.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, Rohr ti kéde pé òun yóò mú àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù tí yóò kópa fún òun nínú àwọn ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ọlọ́rẹ̀ẹ́jọ̀rẹ́ ọlọ́kan-ò-jọ̀kan tí ikọ̀ Super-Eagles bá gbá fún ìgbáradì ìdíje àgbááyé ọ̀hún tó ń bọ̀ lọ́nà.

English: The Eagles are away to Poland on March 23, before they battle Serbia March 27 in London.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, Super-Eagles yóò lọ kojú Poland lọ́jọ́ kẹtàlélógún oṣù kẹta ọdún tí a wà yìí, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni wọn yóò tún kojú Serbia lọ́jọ́ kẹtàdínlọ́gbọ̀n oṣù kẹta nílùú London.

English: --- Koeman named as Netherlands coach
Yoruba: --- Netherland yan Koeman gẹ́gẹ́ bí akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá àgbà tuntun.

English: Ronald Koeman has been appointed as coach of the Netherlands national team.
Yoruba: Ronald Koeman ni orílẹ̀-èdè Netherland ti yàn báyìí gẹ́gẹ́ bí akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá àgbà tuntun ikọ̀ ọ̀hún.

English: The 54-year-old former international defender is the seventh coach in eight years for the Dutch team, who have missed out on the last two major championships.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, ọmọ-ọdún mẹ́rìnléláàádọ́ta akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá tuntun ọ̀hún ló di akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá keje tí yóò tukọ̀ ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù orílẹ̀-èdè náà láti ọdún mẹ́jọ sẹ́yìn.

English: I think the Netherlands should and must be qualifying for major finals and I see a bright future in that regard. That’s why I’ve taken the job.” he said.
Yoruba: Mo lérò pé, orílẹ̀-èdè Netherland yẹ kó pegedé bẹ́ẹ̀ sìni, ó yẹ kí o ́máa kópa fún ọ̀kan-ò-jọ̀kan ìdíje, mo rí àpẹẹrẹ tí ó dára fún ọjọ́ iwájú, eléyìí tí ó ṣokùnfà ìdí tí mo fi gba iṣẹ́ yìí.

English: They were runners-up at the 2010 World Cup and finished third in Brazil four years later but failed to qualify for the 2014 finals in Brazil.
Yoruba: Orílẹ̀-èdè Netherland ṣe ipò kejì nínú irúfẹ́ ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé ọ̀hún tí ó wáyé lọ́dún 2010, bẹ́ẹ̀ sìni wọ́n tún ṣe ipò kẹta lọ́dún 2014, ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé tí ó wáyé lórílẹ̀-èdè.

English: He will be expected to help the Dutch qualify for Euro 2020 and the World Cup in Qatar two years thereafter, reviving the team’s fortunes in the process.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, ìrètí yóò wà pé Ronald Koeman yóò ran ikọ̀ náà lọ́wọ́ láti pegedé fún ìdíje Euro 2020, bákan náà ìdíje àgbááyé ọdún 2022 lórílẹ̀-èdè Qatar.

English: His first assignment will be a friendly against England at the Amsterdam Arena on March 23, followed by a meeting with Portugal in Geneva three days later.
